unit.utterance_translation: My late husband was not tall, just short.
And his body was thin and (it was) small.
He was not big.
He was short.
Have you meet Mani? His size is like that [i.e. similar to Mani's height].
That is his size.
But as for his body, it was small.
Here, his belly was big.

unit.utterance: Amma mattim ta binara:yan, maski ta daddiman, o:gipanmi tadde:ta.
unit.utterance_translation: If we drank alcohol, we lay down even on the road.
Our only companion was Mani while he was young. [Mani = their eldest child]
We did not have a companion. We were just lying there.
I used a blanket,

unit.utterance: Saya gimtènu a bunbunmi. Take:ta mallinu:nunami.
unit.utterance_translation: That is our house I made, so that we can (stay there).
In the morning, he went back home.

unit.utterance: Abbi:tènnadmandi ti Ma:ni, da awanu ma'abbit.
unit.utterance_translation: He carried Mani again becaue I couldn't carry him.
We went back again.

unit.utterance: Ma make:tadmantèn matti, mattimmandi ta binara:yan.
unit.utterance_translation: When I saw him staying (somewhere), he was drinking alcohol again.
(he) was intoxicated again.
Who are his father and mother?
I do not know because I did not ask it.
Her father and mother died.

unit.utterance: Konta tatawna asawamuti i tyempo na hapon?
unit.utterance_translation: But your husband knew the Japanese era?
He knew it, even the time of Marshall.
the time of Marshall
Sundalo was fearful. They binded men's arms.

unit.utterance: Illa:yug a lubid. Ma manggèpègpèt tidi gillèngani, yangayditid ta lattong.
unit.utterance_translation: (It is with) long strings. When the men were tied up with a rope, they brought them outside.
They pushed them into the water.
And they did it like that.
They press (them) down with a stone.
Yes. They were fearful.
In particular, for example,

unit.utterance: Ayti, ayti Dipintini, attinan na kampu na Sunda:lu.
unit.utterance_translation: the Camp of Sundalo was here in Dipintin,
while we have been in Kalbo.
They go there and get men to tie their arms.
T'was like that, t'was like that.
Some cases. (?)
and there were long strings.
They were non-Negrito. A lot of men were doing a fearful things (to Negrito men).

unit.utterance: Gimpègpètanditid. Guyuguyudditid ti way illa:yug a lubid.
unit.utterance_translation: They tied them. They pulled them with a long string.
They arrived at a wide one (a wide mountain).
If you were slow,
